column4: my computer froze, i shut it off w/ the power button, startup again, try to login,receved error, cant write to authorization file, could be that im out of space or that my home dir couldnt be opened. i tryed loging in failsafe gnome, and failsafe terminal, but neither worked, no error message or any thing.  now i rebooted in to recovery mode, so i have a root terminal, any ideas what i should do?
df -h?
sorry, dont understand
check to see how much space is free on the drive. df -h
says its full, but i had a few gigs left, so i need to find the new file taking up the space?
define 'says its full'
try just df with no -h
delete some stuff. :)
makes sense, thanks, ill be back if that dosnt do the trick ;)
good luck :)
note: du -h can show stuff like filesizes, and I think you can do something to limit to a specific size
thx, that will help
np.
what is the command to delete?
rm. be VERY careful with that
it's kind of like an axe.  If you're not paying attention to where you swing it, you lop off a foot.
will do, good thing is i just copyed entire drive to external, so im safe...i hope
try       du | sort -n -r | less
that will show the filesizes in bytes with the largest files/folders on top
holy cow, i checked the trash dir, only 23 items but the last two were my failed atemps at imagine my disk!!! now im 43% full out of 23 gb!!! thanks alot
Act like it was nuthin. :)
you are quite welcome.  I'd play with the console as much as possible, simply to learn how to use it more effectively.  I hadn't tried that sort trick before tonight, oddly enough.
